definitions.text: any distinct time period in a sequence of events
examples: we are in a transitional stage in which many former ideas must be revised or rejected

definitions.text: (physical chemistry) a distinct state of matter in a system; matter that is identical in chemical composition and physical state and separated from other material by the phase boundary
examples: the reaction occurs in the liquid phase of the system

definitions.text: a particular point in the time of a cycle; measured from some arbitrary zero and expressed as an angle
(astronomy) the particular appearance of a body's state of illumination (especially one of the recurring shapes of the part of Earth's moon that is illuminated by the sun)
examples: the full phase of the moon

definitions.text: adjust so as to be in a synchronized condition
examples: he phased the intake with the output of the machine
